Package fr.univlille.iutinfo.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
fr.univlille.iutinfo.utils.Subject
fr.univlille.iutinfo.game.Game
public class Game extends Subject
The Game class represents a game instance. It extends the Subject class to implement the Observer pattern.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(Maze maze, Monster monster, Hunter hunter, boolean monsterAI, boolean hunterAI, boolean monsterDifficulty, boolean hunterDifficulty)
      Class representing a game.

      This class is responsible for initializing and managing the game state. It takes a maze, a monster, a hunter as parameters. The maze represents the game board, the monster and hunter represent the game characters, and the maze views are responsible for rendering the game board.

      The Game object keeps track of the current state of the game and manages the interactions between the characters and the maze views. It initializes the game state with the given parameters and sets the play flag to true, which indicates that the game is running.

      Parameters:
      maze - The maze object representing the game board.
      monster - The monster object representing the game character.
      hunter - The hunter object representing the game character.
      monsterAI - The monsterAI flag indicates whether the monster is controlled by a player or by an AI.
      hunterAI - The hunterAI flag indicates whether the hunter is controlled by a player or by an AI.

  • Method Details

    • monsterloop

      public void monsterloop()
      This method lauches the monster AI loop or the monster player loop depending on the monsterAI flag.

    • hunterloop

      public void hunterloop()
      This method lauches the hunter AI loop or the hunter player loop depending on the hunterAI flag.

    • setPlay

      public void setPlay(boolean play)
      Sets the play state of the game.
      Parameters:
      play - the new play state to set
